com.motorola.mod

Class ModProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.motorola.mod.ModProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable

    public class ModProtocol
extends Object
implements Parcelable
    This class represents a single protocol which could be used for the connection between device on the Moto Mod and the phone. This class represents the protocols which are declared and supported by the Moto Mod SDK. It should be used to determine which protocols a ModDevice declares, obtaining a interface delegation to a particular protocol with the ModManager, checking the state of a specific protocol ModConnection. While the ModProtocol class declares a set of protocols, the first release of the Moto Mod SDK only fully supports the subset marked as 'supported' below.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ModProtocol.Protocol
      This class presents the actual greybus protocol id, which the ModProtocol instance is associated with.

        public static final int PROTOCOL_ALL

        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocol

        public ModProtocol.Protocol getProtocol()
        The getProtocol() method returns the protocol enumeration associated with this object. If the returned protocol is null, the object is holding an unsupported protocol, and the caller should use ModProtocol.getRawProtocolId() to retrieve the protocol ID.

      • getRawProtocolId

        public short getRawProtocolId()
        The getRawProtocolId() method returns the protocol ID associated with this object, as defined in the ModProtocol.Protocol enumeration.

      • getVersionMajor

        public byte getVersionMajor()
        Each greybus protocol has an associated Major and Minor version. This version is used to determine compatibility between a Moto Mod and a Core during the initial handshake. The getVersionMajor() method returns the Greybus Major version of this protocol, as declared by the attached Moto Mod. This is indicative only.

      • getVersionMinor

        public byte getVersionMinor()
        Each greybus protocol has an associated Major and Minor version. This version is used to determine compatibility between a Moto Mod and a Core during the initial handshake. The getVersionMinor() method returns the Greybus Minor version of this protocol, as declared by the attached Moto Mod. This is indicative only and should be used with getVersionMajor().

      • getProtocolName

        public String getProtocolName()
        The getProtocolName() method returns a readable name of the protocol, as defined in the ModProtocol.Protocol enumeration.
